isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 MODEL - CAB ACCESSORIES - TROUBLESHOOTING - Mirrors

entry.para: Move key switch to accessories position, and at 15A fuse F5-A and circuit 12L, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12AF or 12L from accessories relay (466), then repair.
Disconnect mirror switch (415) and with switch in the on position, measure resistance from terminal 5 to 6.
Disconnect left heated/ lighted mirror connector (31), move key switch to accessories position, move mirror switch to on position, and at circuit 78A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 78A, conn. (437), or 78A, then repair.
Move headlight switch to parking light position, and at 15A fuse F8-C and circuit 68B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 68E or 68B from tail light relay (464-R9), then repair.
With switches still set, at connector (31) and circuit 58B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 68C, 58F, conn. (N/L), circuit 58F, conn. (437), or circuit 58B from 15A fuse F8-C, then repair.
With switches still set, at connector (31), measure voltage from circuit 58B to 11A.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11A to ground stud (J9), then repair.
Circuits to left mirror check good. Reconnect connector (31). Does mirror light and heater function?
Disconnect right heated/ lighted mirror connector (31), move key switch to accessories position, move mirror switch to on position, and at circuit 78A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 78B, conn. (403), or 78A, then repair.
Move headlight switch to parking light position, and at connector (31) and circuit 58B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58B, conn. (403), or circuit 58B from conn. (N/L), then repair.
With switches still set, at connector (31), measure voltage from circuit 58B to 11A.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11A to ground stud (J14), then repair.
Circuits to right mirror check good. Reconnect connector (31). Does mirror light and heater function?

svcsubproc.title: Heated Mirrors and Motorized Right Mirror

table.title: Heated Mirrors and Motorized Right Mirror

entry.para: Move key switch to accessories position, and at 15A fuse F5-A and circuit 12L, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12AF or 12L from accessories relay (446), then repair.
Disconnect mirror switch conn. (415), move key switch to accessories position, and at circuit 78, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 78, or 15A fuse F5-A, then repair.
With key switch in accessories position, at switch connector (415), measure voltage from circuit 78 to 78-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 78-G or 11-GLB to L4 panel lights ground adapter (587) ground source, then repair.
Test mirror switch (415) by placing in on position, and measuring resistance from terminal 5 to 6.
Reconnect heated mirror switch (415), disconnect left side connector (31), and move key switch to accessories position. At left side connector (31) and circuit 78A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 78A, conn. (437), or circuit 78A, then repair.
With key switch still on, at connector (31), measure voltage from circuit 78A to 11A.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11A from ground junction (J9), then repair.
Circuits to left heated mirror check good. Reconnect mirror. With switches on, does mirror heat up?
Disconnect right side connector (31), and move key switch to accessories position. At right side connector (31) and circuit 78A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 78B, conn. (403), or circuit 78A, then repair.
With key switch still on, at connector (31), measure voltage from circuit 78A to 11A.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 11A to ground junction (J14), then repair.
Circuits to right heated mirror check good. Reconnect mirror. With switches on, does mirror heat up?
Does right side motorized mirror function properly?
Disconnect mirror switch connector (540), and move key switch to accessories position. At circuit 78D, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 78D, then repair.
At connector (540) measure voltage from circuit 78D to 78-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 78-GB, 11-GLA, or 11-GD to the left cab ground stud (429), then repair.
Bench test mirror switch (540) by moving wiper to the left and measuring resistance from terminal 1 to 2.
Bench test mirror switch (540) by moving wiper to the left and measuring resistance from terminal 4 to 5.
Bench test mirror switch (540) by moving wiper to the right and measuring resistance from terminal 2 to 3.
Bench test mirror switch (540) by moving wiper to the right and measuring resistance from terminal 5 to 6.

Disconnect mirror motor connector (31) and reconnect switch connector (540). With key switch in accessories position, at connector (31), measure voltage from circuit 78E to 78F while moving mirror switch in either direction.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 78E or 78F, then repair.
Reconnect motor connector (31). Does mirror function when switches are actuated?
Replace defective mirror motor or mirror assembly.
Check 15A fuse F5-A for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Disconnect connector (951) from motorized mirror switch. Turn key on. At connector (951) measure voltage to ground at circuit 78D.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 78D from fuse, then repair.
At connector (951) measure voltage between circuits 78D and 78-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 78-GB path to ground, then repair.
Turn the mirror switch (951) knob to left position. Push the knob to up position, measure resistance from terminals (A to D) and (H to C).
Mirror switch, A to D, and H to C.
Turn the mirror switch (951) knob to left position. Push the knob to down position, measure resistance from terminals (A to C) and (H to D).
Mirror switch, A to C, and H to D.
Turn the mirror switch (951) knob to left position. Push the knob to right position, measure resistance from terminals (A to B) and (H to C).
Mirror switch, A to B, and H to C.
Turn the mirror switch (951) knob to left position. Push the knob to left position, measure resistance from terminals (A to C) and (H to B).
Mirror switch, A to C, and H to B.
Turn the mirror switch (951) knob to right position. Push the knob to up position, measure resistance from terminals (A to E) and (H to F).
Mirror switch, A to E, and H to F.
Turn the mirror switch (951) knob to right position. Push the knob to down position, measure resistance from terminals (A to F) and (H to E).
Mirror switch, A to F, and H to E.
Turn the mirror switch (951) knob to right position. Push the knob to left position, measure resistance from terminals (A to F) and (H to G).
Mirror switch, A to F, and H to G.
Turn the mirror switch (951) knob to right position. Push the knob to right position, measure resistance from terminals (A to G) and (H to F).
Mirror switch, A to G, and H to F.
With switch (951) in neutral position, measure resistance between all of the terminals.
Reconnect connector (951). Turn ignition key to ACC position. Verify operation of the left mirror.
Verify operation of the right mirror.

Disconnect connector (31) going to the left mirror. Turn the switch knob to the "L" position. Have an assistant hold the switch in the up position. Measure voltage from middle pin of the three small connectors to the next pin counter- clockwise from the middle pin.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 78E, 78F, 78H, or 78J, then repair.
Have an assistant hold the switch in the left position. Measure voltage between two outer pins of the three small connectors of connector (31).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 58B, 78H, 78K, or 78F, then repair.

Disconnect connector (31) going to the right mirror. Turn the switch knob to the "R" position. Have an assistant hold the switch in the up position. Measure voltage from middle pin of the three small connectors to the next pin counter- clockwise from the middle pin.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 58B or 78F, then repair.
Have an assistant hold the switch in the left position. Measure voltage between two outer pins of the three small connectors of connector (31).
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 78E or 58B, then repair.
